title: swiss typography
content:
hello

im one of the guys producing the first swiss art pdf magazine, [artstübli](http://web.archive.org/web/20111228160609/http:/www.artstuebli.ch/).

we released number one and are working on number two, which will have illustration as a main subject. number three will probably be about typography, so im looking for some help from you: if you think of switzerland, who do you think of? weingart (born in germany..)? frutiger (well known)? im looking for "fresh heads", if you know some..

thanks!
author: thierry blancpain

comments.content:
Steph Geisbuller, Emil Ruder, Josef Muller Brockmann, Willi Kunz, April Greiman, Karl Gerstner, Fred Troller . . .

ChrisL
Favorites include Laurenz Brunner, Mika Mischler, Gilles Gavillet, David Rust.

I think of Max Caflisch. There's also André Baldinger, Markus Ernst, Ch. Bircher, Daniel Lanz, Edouard Hoffmann. A lot of swiss typographers are featured on [www.fontnest.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20111228160609/http:/www.fontnest.net/ "www.fontnest.net").
Everyone that Chris L said for sure, and in addition to that since graphic designers are being mentioned, Armin Hofmann, Niklaus Troxler, and although I am not a big fan, Büro Destruct.

Andre Gurtler, Josef Muller Brockman and Frutiguer... mainly in my limited knowledge of the topic.

April Greiman is American and did some study under Weingart. He now, or at least did call her a type criminal(ist) when I studied in his class room.

Also interesting to see that at least two of the names mentioned, Laurenz Brunner and Markus Ernst, did a work practice at Dalton Maag before releasing their typographic work.

Bruno Maag  
Dalton Maag Ltd

April Greiman is an American who also went to Basel in the early 70s where she met and married the late Dan Friedman (a classmate of mine at CMU). Her typography was very Basel influenced even though she was annointed with the "New Wave" label by the design press. When I took classes with Weigart in the mid eighties, he spoke of April fondly and referred to her as a "Painterly typgrapher" .

ChrisL
